description.raw:
This PR adds support using vehicles contributed by external organizations. I propose that model submissions consist of a single ROS package that contains the following:

* An ignition-gazebo SDF model
* A URDF file derived from the ignition-gazebo SDF model
* Resources \(meshes, materials, etc\) needed and shared by the ignition-gazebo SDF model and the URDF
* A `spawner.rb` file that contains a `spawn` function that returns the SDF string for spawning the model into ignition-gazebo. This file is to be included by the main SubT launch files to spawn the model. It is assumed that this file will reside in `<package>/launch/`
* `vehicle_topics.launch` which launches the ROS-IGN bridge needed by the model. This launch file is to be used by `spawner.rb`
* `description.launch` which sets the robot\_description parameter of the robot from the URDF file. This launch file is also to be used by `spawner.rb`

Here's an example directory structure:

```
submitted_models
└── husky_migration_sensor_config_1
    ├── CMakeLists.txt
    ├── launch
    │   ├── description.launch
    │   ├── example.ign
    │   ├── spawner.rb
    │   └── vehicle_topics.launch
    ├── meshes
    │   ├── base_link.dae
    │   ├── bumper.dae
    │   ├── lms1xx_mount.dae
    │   ├── meshes.txt
    │   ├── sick-lms1xx.dae
    │   ├── top_chassis.dae
    │   ├── top_plate.dae
    │   ├── user_rail.dae
    │   └── wheel.dae
    ├── model.config
    ├── model.sdf
    ├── package.xml
    ├── thumbnails
    │   ├── 1.png
    │   ├── 2.png
    │   ├── 3.png
    │   ├── 4.png
    │   └── 5.png
    ├── urdf
    │   ├── husky_migration.orig.urdf
    │   └── robot_from_sdf.xacro
    └── worlds
        └── example.sdf

6 directories, 25 files
```

A team submission will be in the form of a PR that adds a new directory to `submitted_models`. To launch a robot submitted by a team, the ROS package name is passed to `robotConfigX` parameter of the SubT launch files.

For example, the [team\_submission\_example](#!/osrf/subt/src/team_submission_example/submitted_models/husky_migration_sensor_config_1/) contains an example package called `husky_migration_sensor_config_1`. To test this robot, checkout that branch \(i.e. `hg checkout team_submission_example`\) and run

```
ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=husky_migration_sensor_config_1 localModel:=true 
```

To be consistent with `robotConfigX` parameters of `X1`- `X4`, an all upper case value can be used \(e.g., `robotConfig1:=HUSKY_MIGRATION_SENSOR_CONFIG_1`\).

The `localModel` parameter is added to facilitate testing during the PR review process. Once the PR is merged, the Gazebo relevant files will be uploaded to Fuel. When uploading to Fuel, the ROS package name must be used as the name of the model on Fuel. This implies following the ROS package naming conventions \(i.e, no spaces, use underscores, use lowercase letters\).

Organizations will be encouraged to name their submission with the pattern `<organization_name>_<robot_name>_sensor_config_<#>` and the corresponding command line variable name `<ORGANIZATION_NAME>_<ROBOT_NAME>_SENSOR_CONFIG_<#>`

The [SubT API Wiki](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/api) should be used as a reference for topic naming and other conventions.

Organizations can refer to the [Model Submission Process Guide](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/Model%20Submission%20Process) for a step by step instructions on creating a model submission PR.

**Requirements**

* ign-launch >= 1.3.0
* ign-gazebo >= 2.11
* libsdformat >= 8.4

‌
description.html:
This PR adds support using vehicles contributed by external organizations. I propose that model submissions consist of a single ROS package that contains the following:

  • An ignition-gazebo SDF model
  • A URDF file derived from the ignition-gazebo SDF model
  • Resources (meshes, materials, etc) needed and shared by the ignition-gazebo SDF model and the URDF
  • A spawner.rb file that contains a spawn function that returns the SDF string for spawning the model into ignition-gazebo. This file is to be included by the main SubT launch files to spawn the model. It is assumed that this file will reside in <package>/launch/
  • vehicle_topics.launch which launches the ROS-IGN bridge needed by the model. This launch file is to be used by spawner.rb
  • description.launch which sets the robot_description parameter of the robot from the URDF file. This launch file is also to be used by spawner.rb

Here's an example directory structure:

submitted_models
└── husky_migration_sensor_config_1
    ├── CMakeLists.txt
    ├── launch
    │   ├── description.launch
    │   ├── example.ign
    │   ├── spawner.rb
    │   └── vehicle_topics.launch
    ├── meshes
    │   ├── base_link.dae
    │   ├── bumper.dae
    │   ├── lms1xx_mount.dae
    │   ├── meshes.txt
    │   ├── sick-lms1xx.dae
    │   ├── top_chassis.dae
    │   ├── top_plate.dae
    │   ├── user_rail.dae
    │   └── wheel.dae
    ├── model.config
    ├── model.sdf
    ├── package.xml
    ├── thumbnails
    │   ├── 1.png
    │   ├── 2.png
    │   ├── 3.png
    │   ├── 4.png
    │   └── 5.png
    ├── urdf
    │   ├── husky_migration.orig.urdf
    │   └── robot_from_sdf.xacro
    └── worlds
        └── example.sdf

6 directories, 25 files

A team submission will be in the form of a PR that adds a new directory to submitted_models. To launch a robot submitted by a team, the ROS package name is passed to robotConfigX parameter of the SubT launch files.

For example, the team_submission_example contains an example package called husky_migration_sensor_config_1. To test this robot, checkout that branch (i.e. hg checkout team_submission_example) and run

ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=husky_migration_sensor_config_1 localModel:=true

To be consistent with robotConfigX parameters of X1- X4, an all upper case value can be used (e.g., robotConfig1:=HUSKY_MIGRATION_SENSOR_CONFIG_1).

The localModel parameter is added to facilitate testing during the PR review process. Once the PR is merged, the Gazebo relevant files will be uploaded to Fuel. When uploading to Fuel, the ROS package name must be used as the name of the model on Fuel. This implies following the ROS package naming conventions (i.e, no spaces, use underscores, use lowercase letters).

Organizations will be encouraged to name their submission with the pattern <organization_name>_<robot_name>_sensor_config_<#> and the corresponding command line variable name <ORGANIZATION_NAME>_<ROBOT_NAME>_SENSOR_CONFIG_<#>

The SubT API Wiki should be used as a reference for topic naming and other conventions.

Organizations can refer to the Model Submission Process Guide for a step by step instructions on creating a model submission PR.

Requirements

  • ign-launch >= 1.3.0
  • ign-gazebo >= 2.11
  • libsdformat >= 8.4

‌

title: Support model submissions

summary.raw:

summary.html:
This PR adds support using vehicles contributed by external organizations. I propose that model submissions consist of a single ROS package that contains the following:

  • An ignition-gazebo SDF model
  • A URDF file derived from the ignition-gazebo SDF model
  • Resources (meshes, materials, etc) needed and shared by the ignition-gazebo SDF model and the URDF
  • A spawner.rb file that contains a spawn function that returns the SDF string for spawning the model into ignition-gazebo. This file is to be included by the main SubT launch files to spawn the model. It is assumed that this file will reside in <package>/launch/

submitted_models
└── husky_migration_sensor_config_1
    ├── CMakeLists.txt
    ├── launch
    │   ├── description.launch
    │   ├── example.ign
    │   ├── spawner.rb
    │   └── vehicle_topics.launch
    ├── meshes
    │   ├── base_link.dae
    │   ├── bumper.dae
    │   ├── lms1xx_mount.dae
    │   ├── meshes.txt
    │   ├── sick-lms1xx.dae
    │   ├── top_chassis.dae
    │   ├── top_plate.dae
    │   ├── user_rail.dae
    │   └── wheel.dae
    ├── model.config
    ├── model.sdf
    ├── package.xml
    ├── thumbnails
    │   ├── 1.png
    │   ├── 2.png
    │   ├── 3.png
    │   ├── 4.png
    │   └── 5.png
    ├── urdf
    │   ├── husky_migration.orig.urdf
    │   └── robot_from_sdf.xacro
    └── worlds
        └── example.sdf

6 directories, 25 files

A team submission will be in the form of a PR that adds a new directory to submitted_models. To launch a robot submitted by a team, the ROS package name is passed to robotConfigX parameter of the SubT launch files.

For example, the team_submission_example contains an example package called husky_migration_sensor_config_1. To test this robot, checkout that branch (i.e. hg checkout team_submission_example) and run

ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=husky_migration_sensor_config_1 localModel:=true

This implies following the ROS package naming conventions (i.e, no spaces, use underscores, use lowercase letters).

  • ign-launch >= 1.3.0
  • ign-gazebo >= 2.11
  • libsdformat >= 8.4
